instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CONN: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CONN? This is the where the batteryâ€™s power rail connects to the motherboard. .
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light and charges the battery but no fan spin. only draws 0.07A
threads.message:
Hi there!

Have a board here without any sign of water damage or anything else. charges fine, although the customer did complain that the light on the charger was dim and it wasn't charging. It does charge on my chargers.

It's not the DC in board. DCin is present at <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is present. although <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL> is showing 12.56v. I have caught it pulsing once or twice which was interesting. Maybe my multimeter?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light and charges the battery but no fan spin. only draws 0.07A
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL> goes from 30V to 0 in about 10 seconds and then repeats. once the board has had power for a little bit it's back to 12.56v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light and charges the battery but no fan spin. only draws 0.07A
threads.message:
30V surelly???
Do you get any pulse at the secondary supplies?
Short power pads on the board for test.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light and charges the battery but no fan spin. only draws 0.07A
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL> cannot be 30v since there is nothing that high in this area, even if you have the charger sending 18v directly to the battery(which can happen rarely but machine will turn off ISL if you plug a battery in when the top FET is shorted) it will be 18v. Something is off with those measurements.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light and charges the battery but no fan spin. only draws 0.07A
threads.message: Sorry i made a silly mistake. It's actually pulsing from 3v to 0. Sometimes it's a steady 12.56. really odd. Would <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> be causing that?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light and charges the battery but no fan spin. only draws 0.07A
threads.message: wtf. now it's no longer showing a green light and the board is drawing 0.140A instead of 0.06A like it did before

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light and charges the battery but no fan spin. only draws 0.07A
threads.message: Ok PPcharger DCIN is only measuring at 14V now at <CAPACITOR>C7005</CAPACITOR> and <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> is getting VERY hot

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light and charges the battery but no fan spin. only draws 0.07A
threads.message:
Remove F7040 and check voltage at <CAPACITOR>C7040</CAPACITOR>.
If bad, problem on <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> area.
If OK, post resistance to ground on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and the coils of all secondary supplies.

Check first for correct voltage at L6995...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light and charges the battery but no fan spin. only draws 0.07A
threads.message: AHA!!!! before that resister im getting 17.62V. on the other side im getting 14.8. is that normal?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light and charges the battery but no fan spin. only draws 0.07A
threads.message:
Post resistance to ground at <CAPACITOR>C7005</CAPACITOR>.
Remove <CAPACITOR>C7005</CAPACITOR>, if still the same value, <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> is bad.

Don't forget to put back <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> with correct value, 20 ohms.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light and charges the battery but no fan spin. only draws 0.07A
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 39003"]Remove F7040 and check voltage at <CAPACITOR>C7040</CAPACITOR>.
If bad, problem on <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> area.
If OK, post resistance to ground on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and the coils of all secondary supplies.

Check first for correct voltage at L6995...[/QUOTE]

Ok so i took those steps. L6995 measures 3.46
<CAPACITOR>C7040</CAPACITOR> is 0.03 before and after i took away f7040

Will try your next suggestion

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light and charges the battery but no fan spin. only draws 0.07A
threads.message:
Ok resistance to ground is 2 mega ohms at <CAPACITOR>C7005</CAPACITOR> before removal

After removal of <CAPACITOR>C7005</CAPACITOR> it is 2.5 Mega ohms


Still 14.8v at <CAPACITOR>C7005</CAPACITOR> after removal

Shall i remove <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light and charges the battery but no fan spin. only draws 0.07A
threads.message: Oh, wait so do you agree that I should remove <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light and charges the battery but no fan spin. only draws 0.07A
threads.message:
Ok so i have replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and now I have 17.5 V back to it. However the baord is still not turning on. There is a green light now though! the board is drawing 0.01 amps.
I'm basically back to the initial issues before <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> crapped out (I assume)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light and charges the battery but no fan spin. only draws 0.07A
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL> is fluctuating like it did before. Is this board trolling me?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light and charges the battery but no fan spin. only draws 0.07A
threads.message:
I was expected diode mode value there...
However 2M is no short, nor low value.
It is strange then that <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> gets hot.

"Don't forget to put back <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> with correct value, 20 ohms."
Did it?

If <CAPACITOR>C7005</CAPACITOR> is removed, correct <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> can only get hot by some avalanche process inside <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>; so change it.
Be sure no short on MOSFETs around <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

threads.message: Your posts change too fast for me...
